docs.title: Introduction to neoLAT
docs.text: NeoLAT (Local Agentic AI Testbed) is a comprehensive environment for evaluating local AI agents.

docs.title: Goals
docs.text:
• Facilitate comparison of local inference engines.
  • test cognitive capabilities on standardized tasks.
  • Provide a modular and extensible research platform.

docs.title: Key Features
docs.text:
• Local Inference: MLX, Ollama support.
  • Cognitive Tasks: Sudoku, ARC.
  • Analysis: Integrated with WandB.

docs.title: Agents
docs.text: This section documents the agent implementations available in neoLAT.

docs.title: Available Agents
docs.text:
• Random Agent: Baseline agent taking random actions.
  • LLM Agent: Agent driven by local LLMs (via MLX/Ollama).

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
• Conda: Anaconda or Miniconda.
  • Operating System: macOS (Apple Silicon recommended), Linux, or Windows.

docs.title: Installation
docs.text:
1. Clone the repository:
git clone https://github.com/StartLivin/neolat.git
cd neolat
  1. Run the setup script:
chmod +x setup_env.sh
./setup_env.sh
  1. Activate the environment: 
    conda activate neolat
